summary: The hosts, who had looked a bit rusty in their tournament opener against Maldives on Friday put on an improved performance in their second match with better service and blocking. “She improved a lot from the first match and has shown potential to do better in the future,” said the coach who was, however, not yet  satisfied with the performance of his team. But my team still has not been able to display the speed they are capable of and we need to work on our block when we play against strong opponents like India,” said the coach. Captain Budhathoki added she was confident of putting a better performance against India when the hosts play their crucial match on Sunday.
title: nepal-rout-bdesh-for-second-win
